meanings.def: used to emphasize that something is correct in every way or in every detail
examples: It happened almost exactly a year ago.
It was a warm day, if not exactly hot.
exactly how, what, why, etc… I know exactly how she felt.
It's impossible to say exactly what happened.
exactly as… Do exactly as I tell you.
You haven't changed at all—you still look exactly the same.
His words had exactly the opposite effect.

meanings.def: used to ask for more information about something
examples: Where exactly did you stay in France?
(disapproving) Exactly what are you trying to tell me?

meanings.def: used as a reply, agreeing with what somebody has just said, or emphasizing that it is correct
examples: ‘You mean somebody in this room must be the murderer?’ ‘Exactly.’

meanings.def: used when you are saying the opposite of what you really mean
examples: He wasn't exactly pleased to see us—in fact he refused to open the door.
It's not exactly beautiful, is it? (= it's ugly)

meanings.def: used when you are correcting something that somebody has said
examples: ‘So he told you you'd got the job?’ ‘Not exactly, but he said they were impressed with me.’

idioms.def: used when you are saying the opposite of what you really mean
examples: He wasn't exactly pleased to see us—in fact he refused to open the door.
It's not exactly beautiful, is it? (= it's ugly)
‘So he told you you'd got the job?’ ‘Not exactly, but he said they were impressed with me.’

related: (it) does (exactly) what it says on the tin
